This is not a complex feature, you could easily debug. There are only < 10 classes.

you mean that nacos yet works in 6.6 version?
I don't know. There are 200+ contributors working on this project, some of them contributed this, and it passed the tests.

> I don't know. There are 200+ contributors working on this project, some of them contributed this, and it passed the tests.

ok ,thanks
Any update?
I think there is no djanggo plugin?

From your log `AttributeError: '_thread._local' object has no attribute 'context'`, I assume this issue is Django-specific because the name `_thread._local` is unexpected by the SkyWalking agent, and it behaves the same as when the assignment `_thread_local.context = None` is absent, anyway, I'd like to move the assignment into the `get_context` function, which should be more fault tolerant, BTW, if you're willing to open a PR, it's highly appreciated @chestarss
@wu-sheng Hi, sheng. I think it's ready to review now. Sorry, It takes a long time.

8.0 OAP cluster not support nacos，because i see document not about nacos，and i try nacos as OAP cluster register-center，but fail
You need to run a standard startup or init-only startup once, then you could start in the on-init mode.
Please send two pull requests. These two things are not related. And powered by page should follow alphabet order.
Your codes should follow the formart. We provide the format file in the root folder.
